intro: Zyrphelis microcephala subsp. microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed zyrphelis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its compact growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, often arranged in clusters at the tips of the stems. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
